intro: Minuartia laricifolia var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited wintergreen, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are distinctive, being large, fleshy, and red, which contain numerous tiny seeds. This variety is often found in rocky or sandy soils in alpine or arctic regions, where it thrives in harsh, cold environments.
